The best game i've played in forever

Really recommend. Always gets updated every month. I got it for $9.99 in Winter Sale. Such a good price. Good graphics, and even you can customize. When it updates, oftenly you get free stuff for your killer, like winter sale eyes (FROSTY EYES), and even the halloween update has halloween eyes! You can be a survivor or killer. 4v1. 1 Killer, 4 Survivors. Survivors objectives are to generate all the generators and get them running and then when all the generators are on and working, survivors have to go to 1 out of the 2 exits and escape. There's also a hatch when there's like 1 or 2 survivors, or when the time is super low. The killer objective is to kill all the survivors. The killer has to use there weapon, (depends on what weapon, chainsaw, fists, mouth) and they have to hit the survivor with there weapon 2 times for them to get knocked on the ground. After that, the killer has to pick up the survivor and bring them to a hangar thing. The survivor still can escape by doing A key and D key very fast. Once the killer puts the survivor on the hangar thing, the survivor will try and attempt to get out or wait for a survivor to unhook the survivor get hooked. In 20 or 30 seconds the entity will arrive. The Entity will try and kill the survivor with the big arms and claws. The survivor has to press space a lot to struggle that gives the other survivors more time to unhook them. If it's too long the Entity will kill the survivor, since survivor is exhausted from struggling. The survivor soul is now carried away up into the sky. Other survivors can sabotage hooks. If the survivor only gets hit once, the survivor can still run but is slower and is hurt. If the survivor escapes the killer, another survivor can heal the hurt survivor, or the survivor can heal there self, with the first aid kit. Survivors can hide in cabinets. Killers and survivors does have perks. Killers can restock there weapon if they have to. One of the killers, I like to use has a hatchet and throws hatchets. They can only throw 5 or 6 hatchets. If they have 0 hatchets to throw they can restock by going into cabinets, and grabbing hatchets inside the cabinets. 3 Hatchets in one cabinet. Really fun, recommending you guys to buy it. It is over 13+ (includes, screaming, violence, gore, drug addicting)

Game is still as bad as 3 years ago. Yes its really fun to play with friends. Many survivors and killers to keep the games going. There's adrenaline when you play.
BUT Hit boxes are trash between killer and survivors.
I'm getting chased and am running towards a flight of stairs leading to ground floor, turn to jump off instead of running down the stairs, I have already jumped off and am about to land, killer hasn't even jump off but swings his dagger in MID-AIR and hits me. 
OR
I run and vault over a window and am 2 steps away and still get hit. 

Hit boxes really needs to get focused on this game. 
2.5/5 for me and I've bought the game since it first came out.

It is always really fun to play with friends. Survive With Friends is especially fun when you have 3 friends to play with. If you are playing solo, it doesn't take long to find a match when playing survivor, but it can take a very long time when playing killer. Overall, really fun and intense game.

Emparejamiento de malo a absurdo... 
Como asesino lo mejor que llegue fue a plata...
ahora despues de semanas sin jugar me bajaron a ceniza 4... lo peor que hay
El emparejamiento ya sea cuando era plata o ahora que soy ceniza 4 le da por emparejarme con jugadores rango 1 a rango 4 de iridescente/oro (lo mejor del juego en supervivientes) siendo que estoy en el rango mas bajo de todo el game
Experiencia de la partida horrible, supervivientes se burlan,te cegan a dos manos, se te escapan los 4 sin que les resulte dificil... (1 partida que pase... bueno, pero en todas ya es injugable)
me arrepiento de haberle comprado dlc pensando que seria una experiencia mas divertida...
hace meses que el emparejamiento era malo pero ahora no tengo forma de jugar una partida como asesino...
